questions.question_text: The use of technologies like IPSec can help guarantee the following: authenticity, integrity, confidentiality and

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
IP Sec does NOT offer non-repudiation. PKI, digital signatures do that.
I would go for B-> Security.

comments.content: It can provide all of the security that can be achieved through cryptography: confidentiality and integrity of the data, plus authentication of the endpoint hosts. The combination of integrity and authentication provides non-repudiation.
Not sure I agree, Non-repudiation says never give room for anyone or any subject to deny their action on any object. So Ipsec mainly encrypts the communication path (Integrity and confidentiality)

discussion.content: IRC- Internet Relay Chat. A form of real-time internet text messaging often used with chat sessions. Some botnets have used IRC channels to control zombie computers through a command-and-control server.

questions.question_text: A botnet can be managed through which of the following?
Fingerprinting VPN firewalls is possible with which of the following tools?

discussion.content: ike-scan is a command-line IPSec VPN Scanner & Testing Tool for discovering, fingerprinting and testing IPsec VPN systems. It constructs and sends IKE Phase-1 packets to the specified hosts, and displays any responses that are received.

questions.question_text: A security engineer has been asked to deploy a secure remote access solution that will allow employees to connect to the companys internal network. Which of the following can be implemented to minimize the opportunity for the man-in-the-middle attack to occur?

discussion.content: Mutual authentication ensures that both the client and the server authenticate each other before any sensitive data is exchanged. This will reduce the risk of a MitM attack as per my understading

Selected Answer: C
PGP is correct, specificaly GPG which is the free version. The others are not for email encryption

Selected Answer: C
Pretty Good Privacy (PGP)

Selected Answer: C
Pretty Good Privacy (PGP) is a protocol used to encrypt and decrypt data with authentication and
cryptographic privacy. It is often used for data compression, digital signing, encryption and decryption of messages, emails, files, and directories, and to enhance the privacy of email communications. The algorithm used for message encryption is RSA for key transport and IDEA for bulk-message encryption. PGP uses RSA for computing digital signatures and MD5 for computing message digests

C. Pretty Good Privacy (PGP) 
A free service.

choices.D: Hyper Text Transfer Protocol with Secure Socket Layer (HTTPS) C

questions.question_text: A person approaches a network administrator and wants advice on how to send encrypted email from home. Which of the following is the most secure encryption protocol that the network administrator should recommend?
